dt: {bc}whatever is known or supposed about something
{bc}the central meaning or chief end of a particular action or situation
{bc}a transcendent entity that is a real pattern of which existing things are imperfect representations
{bc}an entity (such as a thought, concept, sensation, or image) actually or potentially present to consciousness
{bc}a visible representation of a conception {bc}a replica of a pattern

pt: {sc}idea{/sc} {sc}concept{/sc} {sc}conception{/sc} {sc}thought{/sc} {sc}notion{/sc} {sc}impression{/sc} mean what exists in the mind as a representation (as of something comprehended) or as a formulation (as of a plan). {sc}idea{/sc} may apply to a mental image or formulation of something seen or known or imagined, to a pure abstraction, or to something assumed or vaguely sensed.
{sc}concept{/sc} may apply to the idea formed by consideration of instances of a species or genus or, more broadly, to any idea of what a thing ought to be.

pt.t: a society with no {it}concept{/it} of private property

pt: {sc}conception{/sc} is often interchangeable with {sc}concept{/sc}; it may stress the process of imagining or formulating rather than the result.

pt.t: our changing {it}conception{/it} of what constitutes art

pt: {sc}thought{/sc} is likely to suggest the result of reflecting, reasoning, or meditating rather than of imagining.
{sc}notion{/sc} suggests an idea not much resolved by analysis or reflection and may suggest the capricious or accidental.
{sc}impression{/sc} applies to an idea or notion resulting immediately from some stimulation of the senses.

pt.t: the first {it}impression{/it} is of soaring height

et: Middle English, from Latin, from Greek, from {it}idein{/it} to see {ma}{mat|wit|}{/ma}
shortdef: whatever is known or supposed about something
the central meaning or chief end of a particular action or situation

dt: {bc}to cause someone to think about doing something that probably should not be done

shortdef: to cause someone to think about doing something that probably should not be done

dt.t: I thought we could handle this ourselves, but my boss {it}had other ideas{/it}.

dt: {bc}to cause someone to have ideas or suspicions that he or she would not have had otherwise

dt.t: Don't go {it}putting ideas in/into his head{/it}.

shortdef: to cause someone to have ideas or suspicions that he or she would not have had otherwise
